alert.note: Alert for Clay; Talladega (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 08 at 4:48PM CDT until June 08 at 10:00PM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Urban area and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Clay and Talladega Counties. * WHEN...Until 900 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Numerous roads remain closed due to flooding. It will take several hours for all the water from these storms to work through local drainage systems in urban areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 448 PM CDT, Flooding is already occurring in the warned area. Between 3 and 6 inches of rain have fallen. Flooding issues continue across the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Sylacauga, Childersburg, Wilsonville, Talladega Springs, Vincent, Oak Grove, Bon Air, Sycamore, Winterboro, Fayetteville, Logan Martin Dam, Lay Lake, Mignon, Sylacauga Municipal Airport, Gantts Quarry, Varnons, Overbrook, Hollins and Cedar Creek.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
